item.title: France transfixed by 'no body' murder trial
item.description: CÃ©dric Jubillar has always denied killing his wife Delphine, who vanished in December 2020.

item.title: Egypt's president pardons British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abdel Fattah
item.description: The British-Egyptian activist is one of six people whose sentences President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi commuted, according to state media.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson dropped from charity over Epstein email
item.description: The children's hospice charity says it would be inappropriate for her to continue as a patron of the charity.

item.title: Thousands protest in Brazil against bill that could grant Bolsonaro amnesty
item.description: Tens of thousands take to the streets of major cities to oppose a bill which could spare the ex-leader jail.

item.title: Trump hails Charlie Kirk as martyr to thousands at memorial service
item.description: The US president broke with the forgiveness message of Kirk's widow, Erika, to say he hated his opponents.
